password.Description: IonosCloud password for API operations. If token is provided, token is preferred

retries.Deprecated: Timeout is used instead of this functionality

token.Description: IonosCloud bearer token for API operations.

username.Description: IonosCloud username for API operations. If token is provided, token is preferred

email.Description: The e-mail address you want assigned to the backup unit.

login.Description: The login associated with the backup unit. Derived from the contract number

name.Description: Alphanumeric name you want assigned to the backup unit.

password.Description: The password you want assigned to the backup unit.

description.Description: A description for the datacenter, e.g. staging, production

api_subnet_allow_list.Description: Access to the K8s API server is restricted to these CIDRs. Cluster-internal traffic is not affected by this restriction. If no allowlist is specified, access is not restricted. If an IP without subnet mask is provided, the default value will be used: 32 for IPv4 and 128 for IPv6.

available_upgrade_versions.Description: List of available versions for upgrading the cluster

maintenance_window.Description: A maintenance window comprise of a day of the week and a time for maintenance to be allowed

day_of_the_week.Description: Day of the week when maintenance is allowed

time.Description: A clock time in the day when maintenance is allowed

name.Description: The desired name for the cluster

s3_buckets.Description: List of S3 bucket configured for K8s usage. For now it contains only an S3 bucket used to store K8s API audit logs.

viable_node_pool_versions.Description: List of versions that may be used for node pools under this cluster

auto_scaling.Description: The range defining the minimum and maximum number of worker nodes that the managed node group can scale in

max_node_count.Description: The maximum number of worker nodes that the node pool can scale to. Should be greater than min_node_count

min_node_count.Description: The minimum number of worker nodes the node pool can scale down to. Should be less than max_node_count

availability_zone.Description: The compute availability zone in which the nodes should exist

k8s_cluster_id.Description: The UUID of an existing kubernetes cluster

lans.Description: A list of Local Area Networks the node pool should be part of

dhcp.Description: Indicates if the Kubernetes Node Pool LAN will reserve an IP using DHCP

id.Description: The LAN ID of an existing LAN at the related datacenter

routes.Description: An array of additional LANs attached to worker nodes

gateway_ip.Description: IPv4 or IPv6 Gateway IP for the route

network.Description: IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR to be routed via the interface

maintenance_window.Description: A maintenance window comprise of a day of the week and a time for maintenance to be allowed

day_of_the_week.Description: Day of the week when maintenance is allowed

time.Description: A clock time in the day when maintenance is allowed

name.Description: The desired name for the node pool

node_count.Description: The number of nodes in this node pool

ram_size.Description: The amount of RAM in MB

storage_size.Description: The total allocated storage capacity of a node in GB

lans.Description: A list of Local Area Networks the node pool should be part of

gateway_ips.Description: Collection of gateway IP addresses of the NAT gateway. Will be auto-generated if not provided. Should ideally be an IP belonging to the same subnet as the LAN

id.Description: Id for the LAN connected to the NAT gateway

public_ips.Description: Collection of public IP addresses of the NAT gateway. Should be customer reserved IP addresses in that location

name.Description: Name of the NAT gateway rule

protocol.Description: Protocol of the NAT gateway rule. Defaults to ALL. If protocol is 'ICMP' then targetPortRange start and end cannot be set.

public_ip.Description: Public IP address of the NAT gateway rule. Specifies the address used for masking outgoing packets source address field. Should be one of the customer reserved IP address already configured on the NAT gateway resource

source_subnet.Description: Source subnet of the NAT gateway rule. For SNAT rules it specifies which packets this translation rule applies to based on the packets source IP address.

target_port_range.Description: Target port range of the NAT gateway rule. For SNAT rules it specifies which packets this translation rule applies to based on destination port. If none is provided, rule will match any port

end.Description: Target port range end associated with the NAT gateway rule.

start.Description: Target port range start associated with the NAT gateway rule.

target_subnet.Description: Target or destination subnet of the NAT gateway rule. For SNAT rules it specifies which packets this translation rule applies to based on the packets destination IP address. If none is provided, rule will match any address.

type.Description: Type of the NAT gateway rule.

ips.Description: Collection of IP addresses of the Network Load Balancer. (inbound and outbound) IP of the listenerLan must be a customer reserved IP for the public load balancer and private IP for the private load balancer.

lb_private_ips.Description: Collection of private IP addresses with subnet mask of the Network Load Balancer. IPs must contain valid subnet mask. If user will not provide any IP then the system will generate one IP with /24 subnet.

name.Description: A name of that Network Load Balancer

target_lan.Description: Id of the balanced private target LAN. (outbound)

health_check.Description: Health check attributes for Network Load Balancer forwarding rule

client_timeout.Description: ClientTimeout is expressed in milliseconds. This inactivity timeout applies when the client is expected to acknowledge or send data. If unset the default of 50 seconds will be used.

connect_timeout.Description: It specifies the maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait for a connection attempt to a target VM to succeed. If unset, the default of 5 seconds will be used.

retries.Description: Retries specifies the number of retries to perform on a target VM after a connection failure. If unset, the default value of 3 will be used.

target_timeout.Description: TargetTimeout specifies the maximum inactivity time (in milliseconds) on the target VM side. If unset, the default of 50 seconds will be used.

name.Description: A name of that Network Load Balancer forwarding rule

targets.Description: Array of items in that collection

health_check.Description: Health check attributes for Network Load Balancer forwarding rule target

check.Description: Check specifies whether the target VM's health is checked.

check_interval.Description: CheckInterval determines the duration (in milliseconds) between consecutive health checks. If unspecified a default of 2000 ms is used.

maintenance.Description: Maintenance specifies if a target VM should be marked as down, even if it is not.

ip.Description: IP of a balanced target VM

port.Description: Port of the balanced target service. (range: 1 to 65535)

weight.Description: Weight parameter is used to adjust the target VM's weight relative to other target VMs

connectable_datacenters.Description: A list containing all the connectable datacenters

id.Description: The UUID of the connectable datacenter

location.Description: The physical location of the connectable datacenter

name.Description: The name of the connectable datacenter

description.Description: The desired description for the private cross-connect

name.Description: The desired name for the private cross-connect

peers.Description: A list containing the details of all datacenter cross-connected through this private cross-connect

datacenter_id.Description: The id of the cross-connected datacenter

datacenter_name.Description: The name of the cross-connected datacenter

lan_id.Description: The id of the cross-connected LAN

lan_name.Description: The name of the cross-connected LAN

location.Description: The location of the cross-connected datacenter

active.Description: Whether this key should be active or not.

user_id.Description: The ID of the user that owns the key.

backup_unit_id.Description: The uuid of the Backup Unit that user has access to. The property is immutable and is only allowed to be set on a new volume creation. It is mandatory to provide either 'public image' or 'imageAlias' in conjunction with this property.

image_name.Deprecated: Please use image_name under server level

image_password.Deprecated: Please use image_password under server level

ssh_key_path.Deprecated: Please use ssh_key_path under server level

user_data.Description: The cloud-init configuration for the volume as base64 encoded string. The property is immutable and is only allowed to be set on a new volume creation. It is mandatory to provide either 'public image' or 'imageAlias' that has cloud-init compatibility in conjunction with this property.

sec_auth_protection.Description: Boolean value representing if the snapshot requires extra protection e.g. two factor protection

size.Description: The size of the image in GB

email.Description: The e-mail address you want assigned to the backup unit.

login.Description: The login associated with the backup unit. Derived from the contract number

name.Description: Alphanumeric name you want assigned to the backup unit.

api_subnet_allow_list.Description: Access to the K8s API server is restricted to these CIDRs. Cluster-internal traffic is not affected by this restriction. If no allowlist is specified, access is not restricted. If an IP without subnet mask is provided, the default value will be used: 32 for IPv4 and 128 for IPv6.

available_upgrade_versions.Description: A list of available versions for upgrading the cluster

maintenance_window.Description: A maintenance window comprise of a day of the week and a time for maintenance to be allowed

day_of_the_week.Description: Day of the week when maintenance is allowed

time.Description: A clock time in the day when maintenance is allowed

s3_buckets.Description: List of S3 bucket configured for K8s usage. For now it contains only an S3 bucket used to store K8s API audit logs.

viable_node_pool_versions.Description: A list of versions that may be used for node pools under this cluster

auto_scaling.Description: The range defining the minimum and maximum number of worker nodes that the managed node group can scale in

max_node_count.Description: The maximum number of worker nodes that the node pool can scale to. Should be greater than min_node_count

min_node_count.Description: The minimum number of worker nodes the node pool can scale down to. Should be less than max_node_count

availability_zone.Description: The compute availability zone in which the nodes should exist

available_upgrade_versions.Description: A list of kubernetes versions available for upgrade

k8s_cluster_id.Description: The UUID of an existing kubernetes cluster

lans.Description: A list of Local Area Networks the node pool should be part of

dhcp.Description: Indicates if the Kubernetes Node Pool LAN will reserve an IP using DHCP
